""Scope of Work:We are currently seeking an experienced individual to handle overflow digital advertising work, PPC with some display and remarketing. The ideal candidate will possess the capability to set up new Google accounts, manage existing accounts, oversee campaigns, and provide performance analysis to augment the automated reports provided through LookerStudio. Additionally, there may be opportunities for LinkedIn advertising for specific projects. We have three clients requiring support: a Contract Medical Device Manufacturer, a Structured Cabling Installer, and a Laboratory Consumable Parts Manufacturer. The management will be a fixed monthly project cost, and the engagement is expected to be ongoing. While some existing campaigns require minimal monthly management, others involve the creation and management of new campaigns every 4-6 months.Requirements:- Proficiency in Google advertising platforms.- Ability to potentially handle LinkedIn advertising for specific projects on an as-needed basis.- Experience in setting up new accounts and optimizing existing Google campaigns.- Capacity to manage various client accounts simultaneously.- Availability for real-time analysis of campaign performance with both our internal agency team and clients during our standard business hours of 8:30 am - 5:00 pm EST.Communication Expectations:To ensure a smooth and collaborative partnership, we expect the selected contractor to:- Communicate proactively regarding project progress, challenges, and recommendations.- Participate in regular live analysis sessions with our internal agency team and clients.- Provide timely responses to inquiries and requests, acknowledging emails within 24 hours during our standard business hours of 8:30 am - 5:00 pm EST and addressing urgent matters promptly (within 2-4 hours of outreach).- Use project management tools or platforms for streamlined communication and task tracking.Information Requested:- Capacity for monthly workload.- Availability for live analysis sessions with our internal agency team and clients.- Any relevant experience in setting up and managing advertising campaigns on Google.We appreciate your interest in this opportunity and look forward to receiving your response. ""We are seeking a skilled web developer to create an interactive e-commerce website tailored to sell our services. ""Hello,I'm in search of an experienced software developer who can modify and enhance our current shrinkage module, pivoting its functionality for better surplus management.Manufacturing Module WorkflowSelect the desired product to manufacture.Set the quantity to be produced and save the order.Verify the availability of the product for manufacturing.Record the total production.If there is a loss, record the loss.Validate the production order.Changes to be made to the module:Add a button for surplus registration.Surplus: The final production exceeds expectations.Loss: The final production does not meet expectations.The functionality of the button will be the opposite of the loss. When there is a surplus, it should increase the quantity of the final product produced by updating the production yield without affecting the quantities of materials used.*Add a button next to the loss button.Main Requirements:- Enable us to input the possibility of quantities exceeding 100% in production, meaning if we aim for 100 units and use 100% of the material, it turns out we manage to produce 105, allowing these 5 extra to be entered.-We need to apply an adjustment to our module in order to take control of the surplus. Currently, our system allows us to calculate a shrinkage of finished products. This means that while the material is consumed 100%, it does not manage to produce 100% of the final product due to defects or waste; instead, it only produces 80%. This allows us to close the production process and for the system to accept these differences. We need to apply this in reverse, that is, to use 100% of the raw material but in this case, to produce more than 100% of the finished product.-We can use the same shrinkage workflow, simply reversing it, so to speak. The button should appear as "Surplus" alongside the shrinkage button.Current Scenario: We use a combination of manual and automated tracking to measure production levels.Expected Improvements: We expect important upgrades in our tracking process. The key improvement sought is real-time updating of production levels, offering live updates to manage surpluses effectively at any given moment.Ideal skill set for this project:- Experience with software development odoo 11- Expertise in automated tracking solutions- Good understanding of production management systems in odoo 11- Experience with real-time data integration.Regards,Team Softechies SolutionsBudget: $70Posted On: February 19, 2024 22:51 UTCCategory: Full Stack DevelopmentSkills:Odoo, Odoo Development, Customer Relationship Management, Python, PHP, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, MySQL, PostgreSQLSkills: Odoo, Odoo Development, Customer Relationship Management, Python, PHP, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, MySQL, PostgreSQLCountry: Pakistan""

Improve this resume bullet:
""**Time Auction UXUI Design Project****Location:** Quarry Bay, Hong Kong / Remote (1 day in office is preferred)**Project Duration:** Feb-Apr 2024### ObjectiveWe are looking for a UX/UI designer to help design an additional workflow of our existing volunteer projects feature. Specifically, to create a new user journey and design for volunteer projects, where participants would receive an instant confirmation upon registering and have the ability to invite friends to join.**Background & About Time Auction**[Time Auction]([REDACTED_URL] is a charity that advocates volunteerism. We encourage volunteering with inspiring experiences, while connecting skilled-volunteers with NGOs. Our platform matches individuals who want to volunteer their talent with nonprofits that need those skills. Since 2014, over 230,000 volunteer hours have been contributed by the Time Auction community.Currently, NGOs can post skilled volunteer projects, where volunteers can apply and fill in details such as a self-introduction and LinkedIn profile. NGOs will receive the applications and select suitable candidates to reach out for an interview. Due to the popularity of some of these projects, only about 25% of project applications successfully receive an offer from the NGO to conduct the project, resulting in disappointment for the majority of volunteers who did not receive an offer.**We would like to add a new function to the project posting process, with an objective to further utilize the matching platform by lowering the barriers to application and speeding up the process.** For certain projects that NGOs do not need to interview the candidates (such as helpers to sell flags on Flag Day), volunteers can register and instantly receive a confirmation with instructions on how to join (e.g., meet at MTR at 10 am on the day). Additionally, volunteers can also invite and register their friends to join these instantly confirmed volunteer opportunities.As a UX/UI designer, your responsibilities will include creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes, which will be used for Usability Testing with a small number of NGOs and volunteers. You will work closely with our Product Manager and development team to implement the design.### Features addedThe UX/UI designer will review our existing user experience from both a volunteer and NGO perspective and create a new additional workflow for these instantly confirmed projects. The interfaces that will be enhanced and designed include:- **Volunteer sign-up process**, including registration, invitation, confirmation, and other relevant elements- **NGO post-project process**, including the option to select the registration method as instant confirmation, additional questions and/or terms, the option to include custom rich-text instructions which volunteers will receive upon confirmation, and other relevant elements- **Projects page** ([REDACTED_URL] **filter and Project preview cards** so users can easily identify and filter instantly confirmed projects- **Our backend admin system** with relevant fields and info displayed for our team to review and edit if neededThe goal of this redesign is to enable volunteers to easily sign up for volunteer projects that they can join and allow NGOs to post more types of volunteer opportunities on our platform.### Responsibilities- Communicate with our team and/or users to understand the needs, goals, and pain points when engaging with our platform- Develop user personas and user journey maps to guide the design process, as well as user acceptance test to collect feedback- Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to illustrate design ideas and concepts- Work with our Product Manager and Developers to ensure the design is implemented effectively and efficiently- Ensure the design aligns with the brand identity and meets the business objectives- 1-2 days per week in our office would be preferredTo apply, please email hongkong[at]timeauction.org with the subject line "UXUI Designer - [your name]". Thanks!Hourly Range: $17.00-$25.00Posted On: February 16, 2024 03:11 UTCCategory: UX/UI DesignSkills:User Interface Design, Mockup, Usability Testing, Figma, Wireframing, User Flow, Web DesignSkills: User Interface Design, Mockup, Usability Testing, Figma, Wireframing, User Flow, Web DesignCountry: Hong Kong""

""Can you create an exciting video by editing to the beat of the music, adding graphics and cool transitions? We need an editor who tell a story with a vlog and make any challenge or experience be exciting or emotional. Can you communicate via the Upwork app (or text) as late as 10pm Pacific time? Are you trying to be an influencer, or are you focused on editing for influencers?Turn-around times needed:First draft 2-3 daysSecond/Other drafts: 1 day per draftCommunication:Editor can respond to email or messages within an hour or two to ensure prompt communication.Typical Raw Footage2-5 GB70-120 files (most files are only 5-20 seconds long)20-50 minutes of footage cut down to a 10-20 minute video.Budget: 45-$50 (once the editor has demonstrated similar proficiency as our top editors they can be moved from $45 to $50,Every video is different...some may be a little more footage than average and some may be a little less. The editor will quickly get a good feel for the workload.Higher Paying ProjectsSome videos may be larger than typical either because of additional footage or significantly more intensive editing requirements. We will specify the higher budget beforehand if we feel that the video qualifies for a higher budget.Video types:vlogs, challenges, travel, experiences, birthdays, sports, music, etc.Technical Specs:Dropbox: We use Dropbox to share and transfer files and rendered video projects. You will need a Dropbox subscription that allows for more than 2 GB.Music Library (we provide this)Tips for Songs: change music every minute or two, or as needed to tell a story, match a style/scene. The video should almost always have music. The only time we don't want a music track is if there is good reason such as when we are playing an instrument or singing.Intro/Outro: we provide the intro. and the editor makes a short outro (typically 10 seconds)Channel Bug: we have a few but the editor normally creates one for the video.Video Quality: we film in 1920 x 1080 at 60 frames per second so please render in the same quality. The overall data/bit rate should be around 24,000-25,000. If you are choosing the highest quality within 1080HD then it should be fine. Choose 60p (not 60i) if you have the choice.Audio Tips:Make sure the music is not overpowering our voices.Don't mute things too often. We want to hear the sounds of the family and the sounds of nature. The talking & interactions keep it down-to-earth and real.Voiceovers can be used in a variety of situations (like when we are showing our vlogging faces for too long).Pacing:First Minute = Best MinuteThe first minute or the vlog should be the best minute. YouTube is extremely competitive, and viewers will quickly click away if the content is not exciting. Storytelling, graphics, great music, fast pacing are essential but most critical in the first few minutes.Teasers:Short teasers are sometimes used to give the viewer a quick glance of upcoming dramatic or exciting parts of a video.The best way to get to know our style is to watch some of our videos! We can send you examples of our different types of videos and you can also find them by browsing through our playlists.Let me know why I should consider you for a phone interview.
